intro: Psychotria mandrarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various local wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
